newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil has $56 mln trade gap so far in August.
newsitem.headline: Brazil has $56 mln trade gap so far in August.

text.p: Brazil posted a $56 million trade deficit between August 1-17, a spokeswoman for the Ministry of Industry and Commerce said.
The spokeswoman said exports in the third week of the month were $1.17 billion and imports $1.412 billion, giving a deficit for the week of $242 million.
The third week's result turned a $186 million trade surplus in the first two weeks of August into a $56 million deficit.
Average daily exports in the third week of the month were $234 million and average daily imports $282.4 million, the spokeswoman said.
